item.title: Tithing and the Pursuit of God
item.itunes:author: Antioch Church
item.itunes:subtitle: Ken tackles a difficult subject: the relationship between our money and our walk with God.

item.title: Why Believe? Part II - World Religions
item.itunes:author: Antioch Church
item.itunes:subtitle: Mike Caba, Professor at Kilns College in Bend, OR, discusses how to engage a pluralistic society without being disrespectful or making erroneous claims about other religions.

item.title: Why Believe? Part I - Why Believe the Christian Worldview?
item.itunes:author: Antioch Church
item.itunes:subtitle: Rick Gerhardt, Biologist and Christian Apologist, discusses some of the philosophical reasons why we believe Christianity is true.

item.title: Wisdom Part V - Am I Judas?
item.itunes:author: Antioch Church
item.itunes:subtitle: Ken wraps up The Wisdom Series with a message on betrayal, loving like Christ, and having grace for others.

item.title: Wisdom Part IV - The Problem of Envy and the Wisdom of Humility
item.itunes:author: Antioch Church
item.itunes:subtitle: Ken continues The Wisdom Series with a message on envy and the relationship between contentment and humility.

item.title: Wisdom Part III - Wisdom, Happiness & The Good Life
item.itunes:author: Antioch Church
item.itunes:subtitle: Ken continues The Wisdom Series with a message on the relationship between finding happiness, pursuing God and living well.

item.title: Wisdom Part II - Empathy, Dignity and Remembrance in the Love of God and Neighbor
item.itunes:author: Antioch Church
item.itunes:subtitle: Ken continues the Wisdom series with a brief Worship Sunday message out of James 3 on loving the people around us with the way we use words.

item.title: Wisdom Part I - The Art of Influence
item.itunes:author: Antioch Church
item.itunes:subtitle: Ken kicks off the Wisdom Series with a message on James 3:1-13 and the power of words to influence, build up, and destroy.

item.title: Knowing God Part VI - We Are Jonah
item.itunes:author: Antioch Church
item.itunes:subtitle: Pete Kelley, Lead Pastor of Doxology in Corvallis, Oregon, speaks on the story of Jonah and how God can send storms to bring us closer to Him.

item.title: Knowing God Part V - Your Brother's Keeper
item.itunes:author: Antioch Church
item.itunes:subtitle: Ken continues the Knowing God series with a message on being vigilant in our love, our walk of faith, and our obedience.

item.title: Knowing God Part IV - Worship and the Idol of Pain
item.itunes:author: Antioch Church
item.itunes:subtitle: Ken continues the Knowing God series with a message on the realities of suffering and the way pain itself can become an idol, keeping us from knowing God.

item.title: Knowing God Part III - Water Cycle > Word Cycle
item.itunes:author: Antioch Church
item.itunes:subtitle: Bob Shaw, Chief Meteorologist and Community Affairs Director at KTVZ in Bend, speaks on Isaiah 55 and the dangers of spiritual thirst.

item.title: Knowing God Part II - Glorify God and Enjoy Him Forever
item.itunes:author: Antioch Church
item.itunes:subtitle: Ken continues the Knowing God series with a message on the glory of God, the chief end of humanity, and the reason knowing God is so important.

item.title: Knowing God Part I - Knowing God in Knowing Christ
item.itunes:author: Antioch Church
item.itunes:subtitle: Ken kicks off The Knowing God Series with an exploration of what we know about Christ and how that informs what we know about God.

item.title: God's Will Is a Flashlight, Not a Crystal Ball
item.itunes:author: Antioch Church
item.itunes:subtitle: Ed Underwood, Author and Senior Pastor at Church of the Open Door in Southern California, describes several theories about God's will and outlines 8 Principles that he has learned about hearing and following God.

item.title: The Skeletons in God's Closet
item.itunes:author: Antioch Church
item.itunes:subtitle: Josh Butler, Pastor of Mission at Imago Dei Community in Portland, explains a Biblical understanding of Heaven, Earth, and Hell.

item.title: Transformed by Forgiveness
item.itunes:author: Antioch Church
item.itunes:subtitle: Celestin Musekura, President and Founder of African Leadership and Reconciliation Ministries (ALARM, Inc.), speaks on the transformational power of forgiveness and reconciliation.

item.title: A Call To Persevere (The Jude Series)
item.itunes:author: Antioch Church
item.itunes:subtitle: Ken speaks on our need to give up our authority over own lives and persevere in our humility and obedience.

item.title: A Short History of Worship
item.itunes:author: Antioch Church
item.itunes:subtitle: Ken briefly outlines the last 200 years in the development of worship music.

item.title: Clouds without Rain (The Jude Series)
item.itunes:author: Antioch Church
item.itunes:subtitle: Ken examines our definition of Christianity through the lens of the Book of Jude and calls for a deeper, more substantial commitment to the cause of Christ.

item.title: Jesus the Center
item.itunes:author: Antioch Church
item.itunes:subtitle: Ken takes a deep look at what it really means to make Christ the focal point of our lives and allow Him to lead us.

item.title: The Humanity of Jesus
item.itunes:author: Antioch Church
item.itunes:subtitle: Rick Gerhardt, Biologist and Christian Apologist, discusses the varying theories about Jesus' humanity and divinity and makes a case for Jesus being fully God and fully human.

item.title: My Light and My Salvation (or Why I Can't Have My Best Day Every Day)
item.itunes:author: Antioch Church
item.itunes:subtitle: Ken talks about the way our culture conditions us to expect pleasure and comfort, when the Psalms teach us to expect something radically different.

item.title: What Measure of Love Is This? (Love and A Gospel of Justice)
item.itunes:author: Antioch Church
item.itunes:subtitle: Dr. John Perkins, Author, Civil Rights Activist and Community developer, illuminates the connection between the Gospel and our call to join God in seeking justice and redeeming the world.

item.title: Quitting Your Friends
item.itunes:author: Antioch Church
item.itunes:subtitle: Ken Wytsma talks about the practical balance between being influenced by friends and being the influencer. When is it okay to quit your friends?

item.title: Ramblings from a Father
item.itunes:author: Antioch Church
item.itunes:subtitle: Ken points out that sometimes our consumeristic culture can make us blind to the abundance God has given us. When we get hyper-focused on the things we don't have, we can easily forget all the gifts God has given us.

item.title: Fearless
item.itunes:author: Antioch Church
item.itunes:subtitle: H.D. Weddel, Principal at Bend High School and Chaplain of the Oregon State University football team, speaks on taking Jesus at His word and trusting Him enough to live fearlessly.

item.title: A Social History of Grace
item.itunes:author: Antioch Church
item.itunes:subtitle: Could we have an inaccurate definition of grace and salvation? Ken describes some of our misconceptions about salvation and the word "grace" and casts a vision for a more holistic picture of the Christian life.

item.title: Waiting on the Lord
item.itunes:author: Antioch Church
item.itunes:subtitle: Ken speaks on Family Sunday about the necessity and blessing of waiting on God's timing as we pray and live our lives.

item.itunes:subtitle: Leroy Barber, Global Executive Director of Word Made Flesh, an international organization that works among the most vulnerable of the world's poor, speaks on learning to love each other the way Christ would have us love.

item.itunes:author: Antioch Church
item.itunes:subtitle: Ken wraps up The Mary Series with a message on some of the surprising things we can learn about gender and our role in God's plan from her story.

item.title: Mary Part II - The Most Famous Face in History
item.itunes:author: Antioch Church
item.itunes:subtitle: Ken continues the Mary Series by demonstrating that Mary is the most depicted figure in the history of art.

item.title: Mary Part I - An Inconvenient Christmas
item.itunes:author: Antioch Church
item.itunes:subtitle: Sometimes we change stories to make our heroes and heroines more powerful and less human. Ken kicks off The Mary Series with a message on Mary's humanity and the history of the church's views about her.

item.itunes:subtitle: Gerry Breshears wraps up The Give Thanks Series with a message on happiness, rejoicing, and what that really means.

item.itunes:subtitle: Ken continues the Give Thanks series with a message on Philippians 2.

item.itunes:author: Antioch Church
item.itunes:subtitle: If we want to truly live thankful lives, we'll have to let go of the disease of individualism that is embedded in our culture. Ken unpacks Philippians 1 for Part I of the Give Thanks series.

item.itunes:author: Antioch Church
item.itunes:subtitle: Four folks from Antioch speak on four spiritual disciplines.

item.itunes:author: Luke Suciu
item.itunes:subtitle: Luke paints an exciting picture of what life is intended to be when we live in union with Christ.

item.itunes:author: Ken Wytsma

item.itunes:subtitle: Ken describes his vision for a church that dramatically impacts culture by being both relevant and faithful to the truth.

item.itunes:author: Luke Suciu
item.itunes:subtitle: Luke Suciu talks about the relevance of leadership and responsibility in everyday life

item.itunes:author: Ken Wytsma
item.itunes:subtitle: Ken talks about a theology of creativity and how it plays out in the life of a believer and in the church

item.itunes:author: Ken Wytsma
item.itunes:subtitle: Ken talks about the purpose of the church and the need for unity within the body of Christ.

item.itunes:author: Luke Suciu
item.itunes:subtitle: Luke describes why the Gospel is the most exciting story ever told.

item.itunes:subtitle: Ken wraps up the Pursuit of God series with an extension of the conversation on happiness and contentment.

item.itunes:subtitle: Ken continues the Paradox Series with a message on God's power over nature and our circumstances.

item.itunes:subtitle: Ken continues the Paradox Series with a message on God's power over nature and our circumstances.
